body:
## Problem

## Steps to reproduce

```lua
local uv = vim.uv
local reg = vim.regex('a')
local stdout = uv.new_pipe(false)
uv.spawn('find', { args = { '.', vim.env.VIMRUNTIME }, stdio = { nil, stdout, nil } })
stdout:read_start(function(err, data)
  assert(not err, err)
  if data then
    for line in data:gmatch('[^\n]+') do
      local result = reg:match_str(line)
      print(result and 'match' or 'no match', line:sub(1, 30))
    end
  end
end)
```

## Expected behavior
Don't abort

## System info

- Nvim version (nvim -v): `v0.12.0-dev-1966 g4d46d040c3` neovim/neovim@4d46d040c3
- Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?: ?
- Operating system/version: Linux 6.18.3-zen1-1-zen
- Terminal name/version: kitty
- $TERM environment variable: `xterm-kitty`
- Installation: ?
title: sigabort on vim.regex:match_str
